fields.summary: Outerjoin might produce wrong result depending on joinEmitInterval value

comments.body:
[~ashutoshc], could you review the patch?

Issue is not reproducible with Tez join operators implementation, but I thought it was worth to add the additional test cases so we do not regress in the future.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12841276/HIVE-15327.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12841286 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

Thanks [~ashutoshc]. I will modify the test case.

About the first comment, I do not understand what you mean. The only modification was {{!hasFilter(alias)}} by {{!hasFilter(condn[alias-1].getLeft()) && !hasFilter(condn[alias-1].getRight()}}, i.e., checking whether any of both inputs contains filters on the inputs instead of checking the last one, which would only be valid for right/full outer joins.
Sorry, I got confused. +1 You may commit after modifying the test case.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12841528/HIVE-15327.03.patch
